reviews.review_msg: I took 308 with Prof. Erikson this past summer and it has completely changed my perspective on global health. This was, by far, the best class I have ever taken at SFU. If you do the readings, participate during class/group discussions, and summarize the "key ideas" after every lecture, you'll do great.

Professor Erikson was amazing! I loved the material and found it super interesting - I think it's the only course with material that I've actually brought up in conversation with friends/family. If you want to do well: do the readings, go to lectures, participate, ASK SUSAN FOR CLARIFICATION WHEN YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND and LEARN THE STUDY GUIDE TERMS

Dr. Erikson was absolutely amazing! I really appreciated her teaching style, by far the most interactive prof and course. I still remember the content! Definitely learned a lot and she was a fairly "easy" grader when you knew the stuff! Take notes and do the readings and you will be fine!

The most caring and approachable professor at SFU. She is a fair marker and exams are on ideas in class. Pay attention to discussions during lectures. Readings are required to do well. One of my favourite professors. She is very caring, passionate and highly knowledgeable in the field. Exam tip: understand readings and "bigger ideas" in class.

Susan is passionate and highly qualified for this course topic; which is what you would want from a professor. Unfortunately shes too harsh on students. She interrupts students after a few words and tells them that they are wrong. Her tone is condescending which makes lectures very uncomfortable. We get it, you went to Sierra Leone and cured ebola.

do not take this class with her. Not impossible to get a good grade but she is the absolute worst. 80% of your grade is based on quizzes and they are based off insignifigant details from readings. she constantly tells students they are wrong on something opinion based and interupts them. very unapproachable and generally rude.

No laptops in class made note taking inconvenient. Quizzes focused on insignificant details of readings rather than overall understanding making it hard to do well. Also didnt like that she often interrupts students while in the midst of answering a question. Only half the class would show up for lecture, I think because of her teaching style.

She is very knowledgable and her experiences in the field are really eye-opening and make the lectures really valuable. Overall, one of the best profs I had in uni. She really cares for her students and wants everyone to succeed.

Took the 6 week version of the class. Susan is blunt and tells you if your idea sucks but only because she wants you to improve. Her exams promote critical thinking rather than memorization. In class exercises are creative and engaging. A true TEACHER. She even tries to learn every students name. Readings are a must. A must take if she is teaching.
THE BEST PROF I HAVE EVER HAD. I FINALLY FEEL LIKE I HAVE LEARNED SOMETHING AND SHES SO SWEET

Amazing Prof. She was well dedicated to her work and is a relatively easy marker. Her test may be challenging because of the wordings, but all of her questions were straight out the readings (reading were not that long). OVERALL Amazing professor, would love to take a class with her again. Very inspirational.

One of the best professors in the Faculty of Health Sciences! She is very straight forward, cool, and friendly. The first part of the class might be a little bit challenging, but things get way better towards the end of the class! Highly recommend her.

Susan is a wonderful prof! She talks a lot about her field studies, but she keeps it relevant and so engaging. She does expect a lot out of you, but she is easily accessible for help. There are lots of papers to read-don't just memorize though! Her exams are very fair and it is possible to do very well in her class. I highly recommend her!

Susan is an amazing prof, very engaging and enthusiastic. The class has fun activities that make the lectures very relatable, and  participation is important in class. Exams and assignments were fairly graded and shes clear in what she expects. Overall the class was very enjoyable, I would definitely take another class with Susan

Absolutely LOVED Susan as a professor for 308. She is enthusiastic, entertaining and clearly knows what she's talking about. Participation matters, so speak up in class. Make sure you come prepared and DO ALL THE READINGS. 3x 25% midterms, which are fairly marked. Know how to link overarching concepts in the class. Wish this class had been longer!

This is definitely one of my favourite classes as her lectures were super interesting  and her activities were relevant and a lot of fun. However, to do well in this course, you are required to read all of the assigned articles, which usually aren't too long, and learn how to think critically. I was able to do ok taking 3 other classes.

One of the most enjoyable classes I've taken, if you enjoy critical thinking & have an interest in global health this course is for you. Engage in lectures, come prepared & pre-read. She doesn't give many papers, but the few she assigns you should know in and out. Extremely fair exams x3 @25% each, tricky MC. Very passionate and commands respect.

Susan is hands down one of the best profs I've ever had. So knowledgeable and passionate. Go to her for help if you need it. PARTICIPATE!! And ask critical questions, she does not reward floaters. Work hard, the condensed class is amazing. Bring new ideas and you'll be given marks for them. Top 3 classes for HSCI undergrad

This is a great and worthwhile course to take. It's not an easy A and you're not going to make best friends with this proff. That said, content is amazingly interesting, proff keeps you engaged and while it takes work this is the best course I took in my undergraduate career. Now that's saying something! Highly recommend!

One of the most interesting and engaging professors. Clearly outlines what will be on the exam and grades very fairly. Uses examples from her life and always encourages people to speak and share in class. Very available for extra help and always super friendly. I would definitely take a class with her again.

While initially intimidating, she is an awesome professor that is interesting and fair throughout the course. I can understand why others may think she is too hard but if you put a reasonable amount of effort in the class, you'll do well even in intersession.
Bad attitude and very demanding for a 3rd year course. Terrible.
Don't take it if you don't need it!Class average is around C+ which is pretty low. She is nice, but lectures are boring, exams hard! Take it with Kate!
Do not take it with her! Especially not in INTERSESSION! Hard exams and definitely intense for a third level course! She is used to teaching Grad courses, so this won't be any easy!
I really enjoyed this class. We covered lots of different interesting topics. Class was a mixture of ppt slides, discussions and other activities. Overall, exams were pretty fair.

Incredibly patronizing and arrogant. Intelligent professor and very interesting course material, but Susan makes it impossible to engage with her poor attitude. She speaks with a sense of ennui, which is very unappealing. Learn some modesty please.

This was one of my favourite courses ever. Susan's a great prof with some very interesting learning techniques. Exams were fair and overall the class did pretty well. You definitely won't be bored in this class!

Great Prof! Readings were a bit intense (the class was intersession) but overall pretty manageable. Exams were relatively easy - just make sure you attend the lectures and keep up with your readings. There were also lots of fun discussions and actitivies to get you thinking about bigger ideas. I really enjoyed this class.

Susan cares about her subject and I believe she cares about students. However, she is abrupt, incredibly unclear about expectations and treats students like children. for an ethnographer she was surprisingly inept at understanding the ppl in her class. she kept trying to 'read' our group behaviour but totally misunderstood us and our class concerns

incredibly interesting person. puts on an act to intimidate students but is really nice. teaches using examples from her own personal experiences making 308 was a very interesting course - which is a lot more than i can say for the other HSCI courses. would definitely enroll in her future courses. exams were fair, pay attention to detail

While Susan is an interesting presenter, I found her patronizing, abrupt, and low on teaching ability. She was not clear on her learning outcome expectations. As a mature student, I felt like she was treating the class as if we were in high school as she played videos and based her tests on them. Really disappointed - dropped after third session.
